name: Svg2bf4emblem
tagline: Enables import of svg images to use for battlefield 4 emblems to a certain extent
body:
Svg2Bf4Emblem ============= Enables import of svg images to use for battlefield 4 emblems to a certain extent ## Purpose As the battlefield 4 emblem editor is quite frustrating to use, importing SVG's could be nice. Something similar was available for battlefield 3 plutoon emblems I think. ## Limitations The current version is very simple and only supports lines, ellipses and rectangles. None of the other objects that can be used in the online battlefield 4 editor can be used, if you want to use them you will have to add them in the online editor once the svg is imported. You can use opacity and colors will work as well. Line stroke on ellipses and rectangles will be ignored but stroke is how you will decide the thickness of a line. You may rotate and scale and group object but you may not change the pivot of an object or do any free-hand handle transformation or 3d-transformation. Remember that the output is simply one of the stroke, circle or square objects in the bf4 editor, and they can only be scaled or rotated. The current version only support the "matrix" transformation to interpret rotation. Basically, when saving to SVG from illustrator, this is what will be used (all Finally, the editor itself only supports 40 objects, so you are limited to this as well. ## How to use Create an 320x320 svg in your favorite vector editor (read: illustrator, or it has not been tested). Once your'e happy with the result, save as SVG. Paste the contents on the "Try it" page. ## Try it ### Paste the contents of your svg file here
